description.paragraph: Weapons/matrices that you use actively for charging / skills / attacks all the time. When used to describe buffs, it means that the buff is only active while you are on the corresponding weapon/matrix.

Weapons/matrices that you use once in a while for a short period, then switch to on-field weapon/matrix. When used to describe buffs, it means that the buff is active at all times, no matter what weapon/matrix is currently used.

Weapons/matrices that can be used as both on- and off-field, depending on your team composition. When used to describe buffs, it means that the buff is activated on-field, but the effect remains off-field.
A state when the wielder isnâ€™t affected by push/stun control effects (seen as yellow glow on your character)
Area of effect, a skill that covers a large area, not just a single point.
Quality of life. Something that makes playing the game easier for you.
Random Number Generator. A chance of obtaining something. Not a guaranteed outcome.
A skill/benefit that is triggered by you doing something else like healing or using a skill.
2 or 4 pieces of the same matrix.
Origin of War, endgame mode where a team of 4 fights against 28 levels of mobs and bosses.
Void Abyss, endgame mode where a team of 4 fights against 6 stages of bosses.
Main damage dealer. It refers to the weapon in your team that you will be using mostly to deal damage with.
